bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: According to the download page [1] and the github release page [2], nextcloud-client 2.3.1 is available. The latest version in Fedora 25 is 2.2.4.
[1] https://nextcloud.com/install/#install-clients [2] https://github.com/nextcloud/client_theming/releases
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): 2.2.4
I will take care of this in next days

This is even shown in the program's GUI, which is quite annoying considering you always get a notification on login and there is just no update. I've already open a bug report upstream to at least include an option to hide this notification: https://github.com/nextcloud/client_theming/issues/166
nextcloud-client-2.3.2-1.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-b63cde86f0
nextcloud-client-2.3.2-1.fc26 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 26. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-b2d8f94e1a
nextcloud-client-2.3.2-1.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-46798231e1

nextcloud-client-2.3.2-1.fc26 has been pushed to the Fedora 26 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-b2d8f94e1a
